website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot G5 X is a bulkier twin to the G7 X, adding an EVF, a hot shoe, and a vari-angle display. It's an excellent choice if you want a beefier compact.
cons: Burst rate slows when shooting Raw

customer_reviews.title: Excelent
customer_reviews.text: An excellent, versatile and portable camera. Takes high quality stills and HD movies. Useful zoom range. The camera allows manual or automatic control of all settings. Good quality electronic view finder with electronic spirit level and indication of aperture, shutter speed and ISO (film speed). GPS functionality via GPS enabled smart phone and WiFi connection enables GPS info to be added to raw image files and JPGs. The camera acts as a WIFi hub to which the smart phone can be connected. Small and light, easy to carry anywhere. For this reason it does get taken to places and used a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Slush

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My first proper camera. In a sense it's a compact version of a dslr. Much more convenient than lugging around a massive camera
customer_reviews.author: Mac Addict

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: This was a good buy. The camera is robust, and easy to use. The controls are laid out in straightford way via buttons and menus. I hav e enjoyed using it.
customer_reviews.author: beporage

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful compact camera, but unfortunately the warranty card said valid in Australia and New Zealand. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaMcL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pocket sized camera
customer_reviews.text: So many features built into such a small body! I can shoot RAW, do bracketing, macro, exposure compensation. Excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fab little camera
customer_reviews.text: Fab camera and video easy to use not bulky brilliant. Good quality photos.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Pacey

customer_reviews.title: Great compact
customer_reviews.text: Small compact and simple to use. Ideal for just carrying around to take those spontaneous shots
customer_reviews.author: Nick Green

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera - haven't touched the sides of what it can do. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera - haven't touched the sides of what it can do. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built camera with loads of features. However, ...
customer_reviews.text: Well built camera with loads of features. However, my reason for buying it was to give me a more portable solution for social occasions, but I've found that it suffers the same limitations as most non-SLRs and mobile phone cameras....shutter lag, resulting in blurred images, particularly of children who never sit still! I miss the definitive "clunk" of the SLR and the images are never quite as sharp. Early days to condemn it totally, so I will persevere in the hope that I can eventually master it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Garland

customer_reviews.title: It have awesome features like ND filter
customer_reviews.text: This is what you should go for if you want DSLR features in a compact body. Camera is jacket pocket friendly but will fit in your trousers tightly. You should have no problems wearing this thing around your neck all day and night lol. It have awesome features like ND filter, image stabilization, and Wi-Fi NFC to get your pictures out to the world which is very useful. Recommend for any photographer on vacation with family who ruins it with their professional DSLR. Really this camera is for everyone. Love the flip out screen which is good for selfies, vloging and self-portraits. Touch screen too.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Son. We both have one now. This is a very good camera. Quite small but not too small to handle. Has a viewfinder also a tilt screen. We have upgraded from Canon G12's. We also have Canon SLR's and the advantage of keeping to same manufacturer is the symbols are the same.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Items are exactly as ordered and do just what it says on the box.
customer_reviews.author: HenWr

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is not that good, only takes about 60 shots before it has ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is not that good, only takes about 60 shots before it has to be replaced. also quality of images showing a lot of noise, I have to correct this in photoshop, hence only giving three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mr B.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Beware!!! RAW files/photos will not open on computer or Lightroom or Photshop. Only open on Canon software.
customer_reviews.author: W. Crawford

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot G5 X Compact System Camera (Wi-Fi, NFC)
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:black| Style Name:LCDEnjoy expert results, ultimate control and superb usability with this premium Wi-Fi compact, which features a bright f/1.8-2.8 lens and 1.0-type sensor plus a large, high quality viewfinder for DSLR-like handling.

BOX CONTAINS
Digital Camera PowerShotG5 X Neck Strap NS-DC12 Strap Adapter Battery Pack NB-13L Battery Charger CB-2LHE AC cable User manual Kit
feature_bullets: Expertly capture stunning images with a bright f/1.8-2.8 lens, 1.0-type sensor and large electronic viewfinder.
Wi-Fi with NFC and Image Sync make it simple to connect to your smart device, capture shots remotely and then share or back up your creations.
Enjoy full creative control and shoot confidently with fast, accurate autofocus plus 5.9 fps continuous shooting.
Shoot stunning 60p Full HD movies with creative control of aperture, shutter speed and ISO. Keep footage steady with Advanced Dynamic IS.
Capture superb macro and portrait shots with expert control of depth over field for beautiful creative blur.

specifications.Delivery information:: We cannot deliver certain products outside mainland UK
